verses.roman:
dārukaś codayām āsa
kāñcanopaskaraṁ ratham
miṣatāṁ bhū-bhujāṁ rājñi
mṛgāṇāṁ mṛga-rāḍ iva

synonyms: dārukaḥ—Dāruka (Lord Kṛṣṇa's chariot driver); codayām āsa—drove; kāñcana—golden; upaskaram—whose trimmings; ratham—the chariot; miṣatām—as they watched; bhū-bhujām—the kings; rājñi—O Queen; mṛgāṇām—animals; mṛga-rāṭ—the king of animals, the lion; iva—as if.
translation: Dāruka drove the Lord's gold-trimmed chariot as the kings looked on, O Queen, like small animals helplessly watching a lion.
